Robust Engineering
Using Science, Statistics, and Critical Thinking to improve product design robustness
× Home Tools Glossary hypothesis tests
Testing data shape, continuous data
Issue being addressed Tool Ho Ha
Are the data normally distributed? Normality Test normal not normal
Issue being addressed Tool Ho Ha
Comparing data spread, continuous data
Comparison of standard deviations- normally distributed data Test For Equal Variance, Bartlett's (or F) Test Standard deviations are the same at least one Standard deviation is different
Comparison of Standard deviations - non-normally distributed data Test For Equal Variance, Levene's Test Standard deviations are the same at least one standard deviation is different
Issue being addressed Tool Ho Ha
Comparing data central tendency, continuous data
Does data conform to a standard - normally distributed data 1-Sample t test mean = standard mean not = standard
Are the averages for two groups of normally distributed data the same? 2-Sample t test mean group 1 = mean group 2 mean group 1 not = mean group 2
Are the averages for three or more groups of normally distributed data the same? One Way ANOVA test mean of all groups are the same at least one group's mean is different than the others
Does the median of a group of non-normal data comply to a standard 1-Sample Wilcoxon test median not different than the standard median is different than the standard
Comparing median of two groups of data, used for non-normal data Mann-Whitney test median group 1 = median group 2 median group 1 not = median group 2
Comparing median of three or more groups of data, used for non-normal data Mood's Median test, for when distribution of each group's data has similar shapes group 1 = median group 2 = median group 3 at least one group's median is different from the others
Comparing median of three or more groups of data, used for non-normal data Kruskal-Wallis Median test, for when distribution of each group's data has different shapes median group 1 = median group 2 = median group 3 at least one group's median is different from the others
Issue being addressed Tool Ho Ha
Comparing data proportions, from counts, attribute data
Proportion of one group of data compared to a standard 1 Proportion Test proportion = standard group proportion not = standard
Proportion of one group of data compared to a second group's proportion 2 Proportion Test group 1 proportion = group 2 proportion group 2 proportion not = group 2 proportion
Comparing dependencies in groups/levels [proportion test of two or more groups of two or more levels] Chi-Square Test data are independent (not related); proportions are the same data are dependent (related); at least one proportion is different from another
Issue being addressed Tool Ho Ha
Correlation & Regression
Is the data correlated? Correlation Test data is not correlated data is correlated
Testing regression model for significance in session window output after running Regression model does not explain significant variation model does explain significant variation
Testing constant for significance in session window output after running Regression constant [y-intercept] is zero, it has no significance (or not zero and not significant) constant is not zero, it has significance
Testing terms for significance in session window output after running Regression term does not have significance, does not help explain the variation present term has significance and does explain the variation present
Test of model fit Lack of Fit test under Regression Options model has 'No Lack Of Fit', model passes this adequacy test model has 'Lack Of Fit', model is inadequate
Issue being addressed Tool Ho Ha
DOE
Testing the constant for significance in Session window output after running DOE analysis constant is zero, not significant (or not zero and not significant) constant is not zero, it has significance
Testing Main Effects for significance in Session window output after running DOE analysis no Main Effects are significant at least one Main Effect is significant
Testing 2-Way Interactions for significance (or n-Way) in Session window output after running DOE analysis and model includes higher order terms no n-Way interactions are significant at least one n-Way interaction is significant
Testing specific terms for significance in Session window output after running DOE analysis term is not significant term is significant
Testing for curvature in Session window output after running DOE analysis, center points exist and are included in the model curvature is not significant curvature is significant
Testing Blocks for significance in Session window output after running DOE analysis, blocks exist and are included in the model no significant difference associated to blocks a significant difference can be attributed to blocks
Testing for Lack of Fit Minitab will run this test when insignificant terms are removed from the model and sufficient degrees of freedom are available model has 'No Lack Of Fit', model passes this adequacy test model has 'Lack Of Fit', model is inadequate
Issue being addressed Tool Ho Ha
Response Surfaces
Testing the constant for significance in Session window output after running analysis constant is zero, not significant (or not zero and not significant) constant is not zero, it has significance
Testing Linear terms for significance in Session window output after running analysis no Linear terms are significant at least one Linear term is significant
Testing Square terms for significance in Session window output after running analysis no Square terms are significant at least one Square term is significant
Testing Interactions for significance in Session window output after running analysis no Interactions are significant at least one interaction is significant
Testing specific terms for significance in Session window output after running analysis term is not significant term is significant
Testing for Lack of Fit in Session window after running analysis model has 'No Lack Of Fit', model passes this adequacy test model has 'Lack Of Fit', model is inadequate
